alert.note: Alert for Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:56PM EST until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts...New Hampshire...Rhode Island... Assabet River At Maynard affecting Middlesex and Worcester Counties. Nashua River At East Pepperell affecting Middlesex, Hillsborough and Worcester Counties. Shawsheen River Near Wilmington affecting Middlesex and Essex Counties. Shawsheen River At Andover affecting Essex County. Blackstone River At Woonsocket affecting Worcester and Providence Counties. Wood River At Hope Valley affecting Washington County. For the Assabet River...including Maynard...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Shawsheen River...including Wilmington, Andover...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Blackstone River...including Woonsocket...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Wood River...including Hope Valley...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nashua River at East Pepperell. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding is expected in low lying residential areas along portions of the Nashua River. Floodwaters inundate a portion of Route 119 in Pepperell, and also inundate businesses on Route 119 near its junction with Route 111. Know the alternate routes in your location so you avoid areas where flood waters may have damaged or closed area roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 6.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning and continue rising to a crest of 11.7 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.0 feet on 10/17/1956. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at noon EST.
